publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: \footnote\ I copyed out this wicked Paper many Years ago, in hopes to discover the Traitor of an Author, that I might inform against him.
\endorsement 1 on back\ A traiterous Libel writ severall Years ago: It is inconsistent with it self.
\endorsement 2 on back\ Copyed Septr 9th 1735. I wish I knew the Author, that I might hang him.
While the K. & his Min──s keep such a Pother
And all about changing one W──for another
Think I to my self what need all this Strife
His M──y first had a Wh──of a W──
And surely the difference mounts to no more,
Than, now he has gotten a W──fe of a Wh──
Now, give me yr judgment a very nice case on;
Each Q──has a son, say which is the base one?
Say which of the two is the right Pr──of Wales
To succeed when (G─bless him) His M──fayls
Perhaps it may puzzle our loyal Divines
To unite these two Protestant parallel overparalell? lines.
From a left-handed Wife, & one turn'd out of doors
Two reputed K─s sons, both true sons of wh─s
No Law can determine it, which is first Oars
But, alas poor old Engld how wilt thou be master'd,
For takecaret which you please it must needs be a BasterdY06-270A
